lclpy.localsearch.tabusearch package¶

Submodules¶

lclpy.localsearch.tabusearch.abstract_diff_state module¶

class lclpy.localsearch.tabusearch.abstract_diff_state.AbstractDiffState¶

Bases: abc.ABC

A template class to implement a diff_state_func for tabu search.

Implementations of this class are meant to be used in a tabu search algorithm. Implementations are supposed to implement the diff function. A specific implementation might be needed for different move types.

abstract diff(move)¶

Indicates how the move would alter the state if it was performed.

Parameters

move (tuple of int) – A representation of a move.

Returns

An indication of how the move alters the state.

Return type

int

diff(move)¶

Indicates how the move would alter the state if it was performed.

Parameters

move (tuple of int) – A tuple of 2 ints.

Returns

The sum of the values of the tuple.

Return type

int

lclpy.localsearch.tabusearch.tabu_list module¶

class lclpy.localsearch.tabusearch.tabu_list.TabuList(length)¶

Bases: object

Implements a tabu list for use with TabuSearch.

When using big items, it would be wise to save space by hashing them.

Parameters

length (int) – The maximal amount of items in the tabu list.

_list¶

A list that contains hashes of all the items that are considered part of the tabu list.

Type

deque

Examples

A simple example, the lists are converted to tuples, because they’re mutable objects and thus can’t be hashed with the default implementation of hash:

add(item)¶

Adds an item to the tabu list.

Parameters

item – A hashable, immutable object.

contains(item)¶

A method that checks if an item is in the tabu list.

Parameters

item – A hashable, immutable object.

Returns

Will return true if the item is in the tabu list, false if it isn’t in the tabu list.

Return type

bool

lclpy.localsearch.tabusearch.tabu_search module¶

class lclpy.localsearch.tabusearch.tabu_search.TabuSearch(problem, termination_criterion, diff_state_func, list_size=7, minimise=True, benchmarking=False, logging=True)¶

Bases: lclpy.localsearch.abstract_local_search.AbstractLocalSearch

Performs a tabu search on the given problem.

Parameters

  • problem (AbstractLocalSearchProblem) – Contains all the data needed for the specific problem.

  • termination_criterion (AbstractTerminationCriterion) – Implements a termination criterion to terminate the algorithm.

  • diff_state_func (AbstractDiffState) – A class that implement a diff_state_func for tabu search.

  • list_size (int, optional) – The size of the tabu list. The default is 7.

  • minimise (bool, optional) – Will minimise if this parameter is True, maximise if it is False. The default is True.

  • benchmarking (bool, optional) – Should be True if one wishes benchmarks to be kept, should be False if one wishes no benchmarks to be made. Default is False.

  • logging (bool, optional) – Improvements will be logged to the command line if this variable is True. Default is True.

_problem¶

Contains all the data needed for the specific problem.

Type

AbstractLocalSearchProblem

_termination_criterion¶

Implements a termination criterion to terminate the algorithm.

Type

AbstractTerminationCriterion

_diff¶

A method of a AbstractDiffState class to indicate how a move alters the state

Type

method

_list_size¶

Size of the tabu list.

Type

int

_tabu_list¶

The used tabu list.

Type

TabuList

_is_better¶

Function used to determine if a certain value is an improvement.

_minimise¶

Variable that indicates if the function is maximising or minimising.

Type

bool

_best_found_delta_base_value¶

Initialisation value for the delta value of each iteration. It’s infinite when minimising or minus infinite when maximising.

Type

float

data¶

Data useable for benchmarking. Will be None if no benchmarks are made.

Type

list of tuple

_data_append¶

Function to append new data-points to data. Will do nothing if no benchmarks are made.

_log_improvement¶

Function to write logs to the command line. Will do nothing if no logs are made.

Examples

An example of minimising:

An example of maximising, note that the distance matrix is different:

reset()¶

Resets the object back to it’s state after init.

Raises

NotImplementedError – If the problem or termination criterion have no reset method implemented.

Examples

An example of minimising, reset after run:

run()¶

Starts running the tabu search.

Returns

  • best_order (numpy.ndarray) – The best found order.

  • best_value (int or float) – The evaluation value of the best found order.

  • data (None or collections.namedtuple) – Data useable for benchmarking. If no benchmarks were made, it will be None. The namedtuple contains the following data in numpy.ndarrays: time, iteration, value, best_value

Module contents¶

This package contains all classes unique to tabu search.

lclpy
